text: The general Julia <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/networking-and-streams/#A-simple-TCP-example|docs> have some very simple examples of using Sockets; does anyone know of more general tutorials/examples?  My general goal is to set up a server that on receiving a connection from a client with, for example, a data file name, will run a relatively expensive calculation on the data and then return a message with a file name containing results.  I’m no expert in sockets, so I’m looking for examples to follow.
